com.crudetech.geometry.geom

Class FloatCompare

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.crudetech.geometry.geom.FloatCompare

  • public class FloatCompare
extends Object
    Helper class to interact with floating point types. THis class differs from the JDK classes such as Arrays in that it respects a given tolerance for all its calculations.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean equals(double[] lhs, double[] rhs, double tol)
      Checks if two arrays of floating point type are equal by comparing them element wise for equivalence within the given tolerance.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(double lhs,
             double rhs,
             double tol)
        Checks if two floating point types are equal by comparing equivalence within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The first argument for the comparison.
        rhs - The second argument for the comparison.
        tol - the tolerance in with two floating point types are considered to be equal
        Returns:
        True, if both arguments are equal within the given tolerance. False if otherwise.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(double[] lhs,
             double[] rhs,
             double tol)
        Checks if two arrays of floating point type are equal by comparing them element wise for equivalence within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The first array for the comparison.
        rhs - The second array for the comparison.
        tol - the tolerance in with two floating point are considered to be equal
        Returns:
        True, if all elements of both arguments are equal within the given tolerance. False if otherwise.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(float[] lhs,
             float[] rhs,
             float tol)
        Checks if two arrays of floating point type are equal by comparing them element wise for equivalence within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The first array for the comparison.
        rhs - The second array for the comparison.
        tol - the tolerance in with two floating point are considered to be equal
        Returns:
        True, if all elements of both arguments are equal within the given tolerance. False if otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(double d,
           double tol)
        Calculates the has hash code for a floating point type. In contrast to Double.hashCode(), it reflects the given tolerance, so that two floating point types that are equal by [@link #equals} return the same hash code. <
        Parameters:
        d - The input to compute te hash code for.
        tol - The tolerance in that two floats are considered equal.
        Returns:
        A hash code fot the input.

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(double[] d,
           double tol)
        Calculates the has hash code for a floating point type array. In contrast to Arrays.hashCode(double[]), it also reflects the given tolerance, so that two floating point types that are equal by by [@link #equals} return the same hash code. <
        Parameters:
        d - The input to compute te hash code for.
        tol - The tolerance in that two floats are considered equal.
        Returns:
        A hash code fot the input.

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(float[] d,
           float tol)
        Calculates the has hash code for a floating point type array. In contrast to Arrays.hashCode(double[]), it also reflects the given tolerance, so that two floating point types that are equal by by [@link #equals} return the same hash code. <
        Parameters:
        d - The input to compute te hash code for.
        tol - The tolerance in that two floats are considered equal.
        Returns:
        A hash code fot the input.
